value: Plate XXXVI from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Machien for transferring liquids from ships to the shore. Large buckets with spigots at either end of pipes on a screw. Worked by one man on a platform beneath. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-233.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate XXVII from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Machien for transferring solid objects from ships to the shore. Boat right, with man. Solid pyramid in chains above, on a crane-like frame run by a man, lower left. With a lever and weights. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-234.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate XXXIX from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: A machine for masons building walls. A ladder of buckets on chains; going up full, down empty. Four men below, two above, one turning cog wheels. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-236.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate XL from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Machine of wood and rope-work, and weights, left. On it, a steeple for a two-story building. Fourteen figures, most of them at work. Description in Latin of verso of 1949-152-237.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate XLI from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Two towers shown on a cheateau. They are used for wind, sun's ray's, to disperse smoke; two methods. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-238.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Sellier-Carossier, pl. XV from "Encyclopédie ou Dictionnaire Raisonné des Sciences, des Arts et des Métiers"

label: Provenance
value: Transferred from Cooper Union Museum Picture Library (Kubler Collection)

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate XLIII from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Pulley system for a well. Man, left, turns large wheel to a beam, rope wound around it. Cut-away below shows bucket on pulleys. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-240.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate XLVIII from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Pump shown inside a tower, left, cut away. It works by means of a water wheel, right, cog wheels and a curved pipe which moves a piece up and down, and others in and out, to give suction. Women upper right, filling a jar. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-245.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate XLIX from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Pump run by a man, upper right, moving lever to raise and lower a weight, lower left. Water running into trough below man. Bottom of well shown below. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-246.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate LII from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: A machine, center, spraying water on a fire, right. Women fill a large tank of water. A man puts water from that into a funnel above the machine's spout. Machine is worked by a man t urning a screw and plate in the back, center left. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-249.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plave LIV from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: A small boat left, with many anchors out, righting a ship on logs to launch it, right, by means of ropes and wheels. Crowds watch, a city beyond, upper right. Rocks, left. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-251.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate LV from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Machine for lifting a small boat, right, up a cliff from the water. A crame with hooks, pulleys, and rope. One man winding the rope, and two ready to swing the crane, left. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-252.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plave LVI from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Machien for lifting a ship out of the water, right, over a wall. A frame, crane and pipe; grapples on the ship's mast, one man, left controlling it. Castles, beyond, also a town. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-253.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate LVII from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Two covered ships; one run by a water wheel, above, resembles a kayak with a box on it. Below, a boat with many covered decks; an eagle on the prow, right. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-254.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate LIX from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Machine of axel and screws to raise blocks of wood or marble. Two men turn the axel, lower right, and left. Indoors. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-256.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.
